name: J. Nicolás Garavito-Camargo
body:
## About me:
Currently I am a second year Physics Master student at [Universidad de los Andes](http://uniandes.edu.co/) in Colombia here I work under the supervision of [Jaime E. Forero-Romero](http://wwwprof.uniandes.edu.co/~je.forero/), My main area of research 
is galaxy formation theory. With emphasis on high redshift galaxies.



## Research:
### LAEs (Lyman Alpha Emitters)

I'm interested in modeling the Lyman alpha line, for this I use radiative transfer codes based on Monte-Carlo simulations. In particular we study the effect of gas bulk rotation on the morphology of the Lyman Alpha line.

## CV: 
[CV.pdf](https://github.com/jngaravitoc/CV/blob/master/CVNicolas2014.pdf)



## Personal:

Outside academia I enjoy cycling, photography and hiking.
